questions.question: ………………… child can learn to sing.
questions.description: Any and every can both be used to talk in general about all the members of a group.

questions.question: Our birthdays are only a week …………………….
questions.description: Apart can mean one from another.

questions.question: The weather was unpredictable but we went hiking ………………………………
questions.description: Anyway means the same as anyhow. Both words mean nevertheless.

questions.question: ‘Which color would you like?’ ‘It doesn’t matter. …………………….. one.’
questions.description: Any can mean this or that or the other.

questions.question: On the table there were books of ………………………… kind.
questions.description: Every is similar to all, but all is not possible here because it is used with plural nouns.

questions.question: She doesn’t look …………………….. older than her daughter.
questions.description: Any can modify comparatives. In this case, any is similar to at all.

questions.question: Cooking breakfast is an ……………………. job.
questions.description: Everyday means daily or common place.

questions.question: I read the newspaper ………………………….
questions.description: Every day is synonymous with each day.

questions.question: The children were running …………………….. everywhere.
questions.description: Round is used for movement in a circle or curve. Around can refer to movements that are not very definite.

questions.question: I can’t …………………….. to understand his motives.
questions.description: Seem is often used with can’t. Appear cannot be used like this.
